headline: Cajun Seafood Pasta
description: This Cajun-inspired seafood pasta recipe uses 3 kinds of pepper to turn up the heat in this creamy shrimp and scallop sauce. Perfect over fettuccine.

video.description: This Cajun Seafood Pasta recipe is a hot one, but delicious! It can be prepared in a casserole dish and placed under the broiler until the top turns golden brown.
video.name: How to Make Cajun Seafood Pasta

name: Cajun Seafood Pasta

recipeInstructions.text: Fill a large pot with lightly salted water and bring to a rolling boil. Cook fettuccine at a boil until tender yet firm to the bite, about 8 minutes. Drain once done cooking.

Meanwhile, pour cream into a large skillet. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until just about boiling. Reduce heat and add green onions, parsley, basil, thyme, salt, black pepper, red pepper flakes, and white pepper. Simmer until thickened, 7 to 8 minutes.
Stir in shrimp and scallops. Cook until shrimp is no longer translucent.

review.reviewBody: I have made this many times. Excellent recipe. It's important that you use fresh herbs! As far as heat.... cut pepper amounts of you want, but you can't please everyone.
Amazing dish! I added my own flare with using a pinch of this & that...but, the basic recipe was not altered. It is a must make!

I have tried this recipe twice and for me, I had to do the following changes. 1) Reduced black pepper to 1 tsp, 2) Reduced red pepper flakes to 1/2 tsp, 3) Removed white pepper, 4) Reduced green onions and parsley by half. When I tried the recipe as written, it was too hot, and combined with the amount of pepper, it was close to inedible. I cut back on the green onions and parsley because 1 cup each is a ton and you just don't see that much in the photo. I think you can even go less. But, after the changes, the whole family ate it and enjoyed it. Thanks! Will do again.

We loved this dish! Even though I had only shrimp it was really delicious. We are on a salt-free diet and this recipe lent itself well to that style of eating. I will definitely be making it again and again.
I added broccoli, and a little Emeril Essence!
5/30/21 - great recipe! I halved the pepper and it still has quite the kick! very good flavor!
I used shrimp, crab meat and spinach fettuccini pasta instead and it was amazing. This was my first time using heavy cream and I could’ve used more cream but I am very happy with the way it came out.

My husband and I have a Valentine tradition to make seafood pasta. I used this recipe, and we loved it!! To be honest, I couldn’t believe what I was eating, I actually made!! The only ingredient I didn’t use/have was the white pepper. In my opinion, the dish still had a lot of flavor/spice without it. If you like seafood pasta, I definitely recommend this recipe!!

I made a few changes to the original recipe, I added Lobster to mine. I will also next time not add as much Parsley , I felt that it overpowered the Creamy Look of the whole dish, I also didn't add White Pepper, was currently out of it. The fish turned out amazing and I will twik it some more and definitely cook again.
Needs a lot of fine tuning. For one, WAAAAY too much pepper. Do not add the white pepper at all. I substituted Cajun spice. Much better. I also added sliced mushrooms, and green peppers

I used the pepper amounts in the recipe, they were way to much. I diluted the sauce with more milk, but it still wasn't that great. I wasn't too spicy, just way to much pepper taste that drowned out everything else.

This recipe turned out excellent and the family said it was the best pasta they've had. The pasta was substituted with penne and I used cooked shrimp. The cooking times between the shrimp and scallops were different. Next time I would try searing the scallops.

This is my go-to recipe for any special occasion. The spice and flavor is incredible. We are more into shrimp than scallops, so we just sub the scallops for more shrimp. I wouldn’t change anything else; the recipe is perfect as it is. We always serve this dish with pillsbury crescent rolls and a bowl of caesar salad, which compliments the spiciness of the dish perfectly!
Made it for the third time, adding more ingredients like all the peppers....loved it every time.
Didn't follow it to a T and probably could've added some garlic or more salt,pepper and cheese.

Love this recipe! I sautéed red pepper and mushrooms in a little butter separately on the side and tossed them in at the end with the noodles. I also cut back on all of the peppers and seasoned to taste so it wouldn't be to spicy for me, had the perfect kick! This recipe will definitely be saved in my catalog!
My husband and I devoured this! We did think it was a bit overly seasoned, though. Not in a spicy way. Would totally make again!

Where do I begin. I have cooked many shrimp dishes that include olive, butter and garlic. Was surprised to learn that none of these were included and was excited to try the plethora of spices. I followed the recipe to the exact measurements. I even bought all the fresh ingredients. 

I made one mistake and added to much salt, which I immediately tried to scoop out. To compensate, I added the rest of the whipping cream and added some 2% milk (under the direction of my husband). 

 An hour later, I am still tasting the warmth of this dinner. What a sensation to the palate. The such was hot but not overwhelming. I savored every piece. Never had thyme in my food (that I know of), WOW! 

Fettuccini is definitely the serving pasta. And you put have Italian Bread, Carangi's serves the best seeded load and New York Bakery has the best sandwich roles and tomato pie.

I make this all the time. Never change a thing. it's perfect as is. Anyone I make it for asks for the recipe. It's fairly spicy but with the white pepper it's cajun spicy, not hot pepper spicy and I think a bit more manageable for most people.

Holy smokes, this was delicious and so easy!!! I used crab instead and it was hella good! This is definitely a make-again recipe. I used way less salt It was plenty salty. The spice is perfect. I love the crisp green flavors from the fresh spices with the seafood.
just made this for my family and what a hit. This is a keeper, it's simple to make but the complexity of flavors is just to die for.
just made this for my family and what a hit. This is a keeper, it's simple to make but the complexity of flavors is just to die for.

This has become a family favorite in our house! So easy, quick and SOOOO delicious. I make very minor changes; I like more sauce so I add a cup of milk mixed with cornstarch and let it simmer with the herbs. I use frozen scallops and shrimp and add in any other seafood we may have in the house (crab meat, clams, etc) also we are in Maryland, so of course add Old bay! you can’t go wrong with this recipe!!
I don't know if we we're just hungry but yeah. my family smashed it! only thing i used different instead of whipping cream i used Creme fraiche instead....its what i had on had.
HOT!! HOT!! HOT!! The first time I made it I followed the recipe as is, the second time I cut back on the red pepper flakes, black & white pepper and it was still almost to hot to enjoy.

I really enjoyed this pasta. I made this recipe as written. I do like spicy food and this was definitely spicy. I may decrease the amount of each pepper by a tad the next time I make this. I look forward to enjoying this pasta again. It had a great flavor.

LOVED IT!! Quick and simple for a weeknight meal with great flavor. That cream sauce is amazing, creamy and spicy. I used the amount of red pepper it called for and it was spicy but not over the top. Will be adding to my monthly rotation of meals. Husband just raved about it. May try with leftover roasted chicken next time.

we loved this recipe--thank you!!
So, I have been making this for almost 7 years now!! I make it 3-4 times/year & I make enough that we eat it for several days. I have made it every which way adding this or subbing that until we found the way we like best. We like it thick like alfredo, so I start out making a roux with 1/2 c unsalted butter & 1/2 c flour. After the roux is done I stir in 1 qt 1/2 & 1/2. I saute my green onions (the whole onion + the green part) in a smidgen of butter in a separate pan & add it to the pot. Add all the herbs & spices-I use all dry. I also add about 1 1/2 T of garlic powder & about 3 T of Cajun seasoning. I heat until it starts to boil & it will be thick. Place on back burner on warm while starting the fettuccine. Noodles take about 12 min, so when they have been in for 6 I turn up the heat on my sauce to med & I add my cheeses (little @ a time) & 2 lbs of med shrimp & 1- 12oz pkg of Imitation crab sticks cut into big chunks. Let the seafood heat up & it is done. I also LOVE fresh sauteed mushrooms with this, but have to add them separately because kids won't eat them. Thank you so much for a recipe that we have enjoyed for years & will continue to do so!
Made for hubby's birthday and was enjoyed. Good but won't make again. I know it's cajun but I prefer cajun that uses multiple spices rather than mostly pepper.
Did not make any changes. I’ve been making this for atleast 6 years every now and then. :)
There is nothing Cajun about this pasta. simply using pepper doesn't make it Cajun. None of the seasonings are Cajun. In Louisiana, we don't eat scallops. if you're looking for Cajun, this is not it.

Usually, the comments help me out, this time they did not. When I think of Cajun cooking I think of rich and spicy flavour. I saw that people found this too hot so I backed off the red and black pepper. The sauce was still very good, but a little light on heat. I guess you can always add afterwords. I will make this again, and use the original amount of spice.

I really liked this recipe, as did my guests. I am not sure why it is called Cajun, however. I added a quarter teaspoon of Tony Chachere's spice to liven it up and did not add the salt. Also, I used sea scallops, turned out great!
Excellent!

I made the following changes because it is what I had on hand: used dry herbs instead of fresh; added 2 tbps of pasta water to marry the sauce; used angel hair pasta instead of linguini. I did not add white pepper (didn’t have any) so I doubled the black pepper. I also doubled the shrimp because I didn’t have any scallops. I would make this recipe again. It was very good and took less than a half hour to make!
I made this for 7 people - I adjusted the recipe to use more whipping cream as I had more seafood than half cup. Everyone loved it -
I took it easy on the peppers for my wife, it was fantastic. I will be making this on a regular basis

This is now a go to recipe. Made it with some of the changes others had. Added green pepper and mushrooms. Other than that, I followed the recipe. IT WAS WONDERFUL!

Easy to make and sooo yummy.

This recipe is a spicy Seafood Alfredo with Swiss cheese (the Swiss cheese seemed out of place).
I agree with another reviewer, if you omitted most of the pepper, it would have a more balanced flavor (and eliminate the bitterness) and you could actually taste the seafood. I adjusted the recipe by using 1/2 & 1/2, used corn starch to thicken, omitting the white pepper, using only 1/2 teaspoon of black ground pepper and just a touch of red pepper flakes, omitted the swiss cheese and added a splash of vermouth. If I have seafood in a dish, I like to taste the flavors. The changes I made allowed the seafood to shine.
Thumbs up
Came out amazing!!! Even my picky kids like it
Followed the recipe only adding a little extra cheese to the sauce in order to thicken in up a bit. I also added some calamari just for some extra seafood! It was amazing!!
LOVE! The only changes I made were less parsley, more seafood, more cream and linguine instead of fettuccine. I’ve made it several times because it’s my husband’s absolute favorite!
Surprisingly fantastic!
awesome this is definitely a KEEPER!!!!!!

Second time deliciousness. I made a couple of changes :Used Tony Chachere Creole Seasoning. Use 2-3 tablespoons to taste. I started with 2 replaced all spice except fresh basil :Sautéed the shrimp and scallops in 3 tablespoons unsalted butter with 2 tablespoons minced garlic :added scallops and shrimp and pan butter/garlic after 7 minutes of sauce cooking :only had an Italian blend cheese and parmigiana so I used 1/2 cup each I put the fettuccine in with the sauce and let it soak up the goodness for 3 minutes and served
I made this exactly how it is written and it is absolutely perfect. No need to change anything. Love it! My husband's absolute favorite.
Love this pasta!! A family favorite , the only change that I made to this pasta was adding garlic to it.
Did not use the white pepper or red pepper, and the dish was amazing. I also cut down on the salt and pepper and added the spices by feel instead of exactly how it was listed . 10/10
I did add garlic and cajun seasoning and had lemon wedges for serving otherwise followed the recipe. Awesome flavour !!!
I used different seafood Mahdi Mahdi,, clam with the scallops . Wasn't hot enough so I added cayenne pepper. Still was wonderful

Hubby hates any sort of “cream” or “alfredo-y” pasta sauce. He gobbled this up & gave rave reviews! Whole family, including extended, looved it. If you love cream/white sauces but wish it wasn’t heavy (& know that a “white wine” sauce is NEVER the same) this is for you! A+
It was a tad spicy, but it was so good that it doesnt matter. Delicious!!!
yummy!
Good as is!
I’m not a fan of scallops so I used shrimp and lobster. It was delicious

Ok so when I first started cooking on my own I looked up recipes for what my family might like and I stumbled upon this recipe. It was a huge hit, so much they kept asking for it. Either way, I changed a few things from the original so I don't use the recommended amount for the spices I tend to just guess on it. The other changes made is that I use swiss and mozzarella instead of parmesan, I also switched the scallops with chicken I pan fry the chicken with garlic salt and seasoned salt and add lime before mixing it in with the sauce at the end. Either way, it has become my best dish that keeps evolving and one that my family keeps asking for.

This sauce definitely has kick which I enjoyed but found the salt was too much. I’d cut the salt next time and probably try a lighter cream and reduce it until it’s thicker and creamier. This is a Cajun sauce not an Alfredo sauce.

So delicious! I omitted the white pepper (because I didn't have any) and was glad I did - it has plenty of kick without that. I also cooked mine in a cast iron skillet and finished it off for 5 minutes under the broiler.

My girlfriend had made a comment, saying that she wanted something with Shrimp and because I aim to please, I made this recipe for her.

It was very easy to complete and so delicious (for us both) that she wants it again and again!
Great dish
This dish is amazing! Great flavor. We substituted cod for the scallops, it was a delicious alternative.

Fantastic recipe. I've made it several times and it never dissapoints. My family likes spicy food so I upped the amount of pepper. This last time I added crab and crawfish tails. Whatever the tails were packed in thinned out the sauce to much. Threw some more cheese into it and it thickened back up.

I added smoked sausage & scallops. I did not let the sauce get thick I wanted it creamy so soon as I poured the heavy cream in started to add my meats and seasonings. I added more seasoning for taste . Once the meat was done I poured it all over my pasta ! Will feed about 5 good portions. I will make again!
Delicious! Very easy, great taste. I do a lot of Cajun cooking and this was a pleasant surprise for us.
We will definitely be making this again!

Loved it!!! Sautéed garlic, mushrooms and green onions first. Added spices and included Cajun seasoning. Followed the rest of the recipe except I added extra cheese to make it creamy and thick! It’s a definite do it again recipe!!

Loved it!!! Sautéed garlic, mushrooms and green onions first. Added spices and included Cajun seasoning. Followed the rest of the recipe except I added extra cheese to make it creamy and thick! It’s a definite do it again recipe!!

Great recipe! I made a few changes: 1. added minced garlic, green pepper & butter for sautéing before adding to cream mixture 2. omitted white pepper (after first time making it) 3. increased seafood 1 lb shrimp 3/4 lb scallops works best! 4. reserve 1/4 sauce to toss with pasta 5. hold off on making pasta as angel hair takes only minutes to make

I made it, and it turned out really good! Actually it tasted better the next day. I followed the recipe, the only thing I did was pan seared the shrimp and scallops in butter, minced garlic, and some of the herbs listed. I probably will not use the whole package of noodles so it will be saucier.
made it for my hubby and I...absolutely delicious!
Added bacon and seared scallops in butter and garlic beforehand.
It was AMAZING!!!! My husband and I loved it!!

I'm not sure what makes this "Cajun". It doesn't have the "trinity", bell pepper, celery and onion. It doesn't have Cajun-style seafood seasoning, etc. Years ago, a co-worker used to make a "Cajun seafood pasta" dish that was amazing. I never got the recipe from her and have been trying to find something similar since. This isn't it.

MINOUCHKA -- I have made this fantastic dish many time. Au lieu of using the black, white pepper, and the crushed red pepper, I used about 1 tsp. or more, to taste, of Cajun seasoning. And if needed I use a bit of black, white pepper, and crushed red pepper, just to taste to your liking. Also, I made it w/ left over roasted chicken au lieu of seafood.... Either way it turned out Soooooo YUMMY!

So easy to make and tastes AMAZING! Usually, I find that recipes with a homemade sauce are never enough for me and don’t usually get thick like an Alfredo but this is plenty. I used only about 1/2 cup of parsley and added in 1 tblsp of cayenne for a little kick. Definitely our go to when having dinner guests

We're no weaklings when it comes to spice, but I halved the peppers and it was plenty spicy for us. Plus by cutting down the spice, the "flavor" of the pepper shone through, which I really liked. I used a pound of shrimp and no scallops (we're on a budget), and added some button mushroom caps that I wanted to use up, which sort of took the place of the scallops pretty well. We really liked this meal.

This was so easy and so delicious! My boyfriend said it was the best seafood pasta he's ever had - including from a restaurant. We did add some Thai chiles and and asparagus and mushrooms but other than that, follow the recipe to a great meal.

I made this strictly by the recipe. A lovely meld of flavor and spices. The fresh herbs made for a very nice presentation and the spices made for a nice Cajun flavor without being overpowering. Don't overcook this into a clumpy clabbered mess like some of the photos show. The sauce should creamy. Anything else and you overcooked it. If there is anything negative I could add it would be that you could reduce the salt slightly, but that is just a matter of taste.
A little spicy, I made it in
Used Milk (didn't have heavy cream) and shrimp only which I grilled and added as the last step. Also added mushrooms and some kale. Definitely will make again!

Rated this based on my changes. I only added 1 tsp black pepper, no white pepper, and only 1 tsp. salt. I didn't have fresh thyme so I added 3/4 tsp. dried and 1 tsp. pepper flakes. I think I'd like the full 1 1/2 tsp. of that and I added 1 Tbls. chopped garlic. I only made 3/4 of a pound of fettuccine. I cooked the shrimp, scallops and garlic separate and added once the sauce was done so they would be done just right. It was very creamy and we loved it.

Will definitely make again however I initially scaled down the Peppers but I found it still too hot for my liking so next time I will further scale down the Peppers. Also only used 1 Tsp of Salt as I thought the full quantity was too much. Other than that it was delicious and no leftovers! Already bought the Cream and Seafood to make again!
I followed the recipe to the T! And all I received was Terrific compliments! I would definitely make it again ! Easy to make . I got the smaller scallops and added more shrimp.
I've been craving this since I moved away from Louisiana. If you're from the south keep everything the same, but add a tsp of onion powder, a tsp of garlic powder, and all the Tony's you can handle.

Delicious could have worked just as good with Linguine I left the pepper out as others had recommended made the sauce in advanced it thickend up but just added milk to get the desired constituency perfect meal to get that Mmmmm

Loved this! It was a HUGE hit!!! Due to some substitution comments, I made the following substitutions: I put in 50% more scallops, added 3 cloves of minced garlic, mushrooms, and green peppers that I sautéed separately and added after the sauce boiled. Substituted part of the salt and white pepper for Cajun seasoning. I sautéed the shrimp and scallops with butter separately until they were almost done, and added them at the end with the cheese. I definitely agree not to make the pasta until the sauce is almost done, and that simmering as long as possible makes it richer. Everyone LOVED this. I'll be making it again!
Spicy!! Yes to everyone who suggested reduce spice. And add more seafood.......

This was fantastic! A dish I would expect in a 5 star restaurant. I did saute the shrimp and scallops in butter and white wine before adding them to the cream mixture.I also cut back on the pepper flakes and added diced fresh jalapeno. Served it with a simple salad and crusty french bread. Delicious!!
I tried this recipe and everybody absolutely loved it! I made it just a little bit less spicy though. My room mate was not a fan of Cajun food until this!

I absolutely love this recipe. I don't change a thing and it is one of my very favorite. Honestly, I haven't had pasta this good at any Italian restaurant. It's a favorite of my husband and myself. Highly recommend!

This dish was a huge hit last night with our friends!

It was easy to make and yielded about seven servings when served alongside a salad and crusty warm bread. 

I made a few adjustments to the preparation and cooking of this dish. 

1. To allow myself more time with guests I pre-cooked the pasta and pre-steamed the shrimp and the scallops. This allowed me to simply make the sauce and fold in the pasta and seafood with a five minute turn up of the heat at the end to heat the dish back up to serving temperature. 

2. I halved all of the pepper measurements. I and a couple of my guests like our food mildly spicy on occasion, and a couple of my guests are crazy for hot/spicy food, so I figured half measurements would work for all of us. Even at half strength this dish is HOT HOT HOT. I could not imagine making this dish at full strength even for the spicy lovers.

This dish was amazing, and I will most definately make it again!

Wonderful recipe. Delicious flavors. We will definitely be making this again. As most people said...you can dial back the chili pepper or just omit it all together. The recipe amount of chili pepper is definitely spicy...I love really spicy food and this was good for me but my girlfriend would have preferred about half of what we put in. So good! Make it...you won't regret it.

I'll have to say one heck of a good meal, I like spicy food, and this has some zest, {I keep all the spices in} the first time I made it was a blind date, a couple I knew and there friend, they all said "Woha" this is Hot,{Spicy} sweat coming down there face, and then all had seconds,,LOL of course I made it one Christmas, to go with the standing rib roast, now since easter is at my house, I have to make it every year..LOL..but I do add blue crab claw meat also..Just cause I'm In Florida, and trap my own shrimp..
I've made this dish several times and it is FABULOUS!
Very good recipe. can substitute chicken instead of seafood. excellent however you want to serve it!
Loved it!!! The only difference is that I added mushrooms to it, but other than that, delicious!
This was very good. If you are into very spicy dishes this one is for you. I'll be making this one again. I was a huge hit!
I just put less pepper because I'm not a fan, but this was fantastic!
